info.title: AttestationClient
info.description: Describes the interface for the per-tenant enclave service.

parameters.name: instanceUrl
parameters.description: The attestation instance base URI, for example https://mytenant.attest.azure.net.

get.summary: Retrieves the current policy for an attestation type.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

put.summary: Sets the policy for a given attestation type.

parameters.name: newAttestationPolicy
parameters.description: JWT Expressing the new policy whose body is a StoredAttestationPolicy object.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

post.summary: Resets the attestation policy for the specified tenant and reverts to the default policy.

parameters.name: PolicyJws
parameters.description: JSON Web Signature with an empty policy document

200.description: Success - Returns a JWT signed by the metadata signing key that contains the hash of the supplied policy to be set.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

get.summary: Retrieves the set of certificates used to express policy for the current tenant.

200.description: An RFC7519 JSON Web Token structure containing an RFC7517 JsonWebKeySet which contains the certificates used to validate policy changes

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

post.summary: Adds a new attestation policy certificate to the set of policy management certificates.

parameters.name: policyCertificateToAdd
parameters.description: An RFC7519 JSON Web Token whose body is an RFC7517 JSON Web Key object. The RFC7519 JWT must be signed with one of the existing signing certificates

200.description: An RFC7519 JSON Web Token structure containing an RFC7517 JsonWebKeySet which contains the certificates used to validate policy changes

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

post.summary: Removes the specified policy management certificate. Note that the final policy management certificate cannot be removed.

parameters.name: policyCertificateToRemove
parameters.description: An RFC7519 JSON Web Token whose body is an AttestationCertificateManagementBody object. The RFC7519 JWT must be signed with one of the existing signing certificates

200.description: An RFC7519 JSON Web Token structure containing an RFC7517 JsonWebKeySet which contains the certificates used to validate policy changes

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

post.description: Processes an OpenEnclave report , producing an artifact. The type of artifact produced is dependent upon attestation policy.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

post.description: Processes an SGX enclave quote, producing an artifact. The type of artifact produced is dependent upon attestation policy.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

post.description: Processes attestation evidence from a VBS enclave, producing an attestation result. The attestation result produced is dependent upon the attestation policy.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

post.summary: Attest to an SEV SNP Virtual Machine.
post.description: Processes a SEV SNP Boot chain. The type of artifact produced is dependent upon attestation policy.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

get.summary: Retrieves the attestation signing keys in use by the attestation service
get.description: Retrieves metadata signing certificates in use by the attestation service

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

get.summary: Retrieves the OpenID Configuration data for the Azure Attestation Service
get.description: Retrieves metadata about the attestation signing keys in use by the attestation service

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed

code.description: An identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.description: A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for displaying in a user interface.

AttestationCertificateManagementBody.description: The body of the JWT used for the PolicyCertificates APIs

policyCertificate.description: RFC 7517 Json Web Key describing the certificate.

PolicyCertificatesResponse.description: The response to an attestation policy management API

token.description: An RFC7519 JSON Web Token structure containing a PolicyCertificatesResults object which contains the certificates used to validate policy changes

PolicyCertificatesResult.description: The result of a call to retrieve policy certificates.

x-ms-policy-certificates.description: SHA256 Hash of the binary representation certificate which was added or removed

PolicyCertificatesModifyResponse.description: The response to an attestation policy management API

token.description: An RFC7519 JSON Web Token structure whose body is a PolicyCertificatesModificationResult object.

PolicyCertificatesModificationResult.description: The result of a policy certificate modification

x-ms-certificate-thumbprint.description: Hex encoded SHA1 Hash of the binary representation certificate which was added or removed

values.description: After the operation was performed, the certificate is in the set of certificates.
After the operation was performed, the certificate is no longer present in the set of certificates.

AttestationPolicy.description: Policy text to set as a sequence of UTF-8 encoded octets.

PolicyResponse.description: The response to an attestation policy operation

token.description: An RFC7519 JSON Web Token structure whose body is an PolicyResult object.

PolicyResult.description: The result of a policy certificate modification

values.description: The specified policy object was updated.
The specified policy object was removed.

x-ms-policy-token-hash.description: The SHA256 hash of the policy object modified

x-ms-policy.description: A JSON Web Token containing a StoredAttestationPolicy object with the attestation policy

AttestationResult.description: The result of an attestation operation

DataType.description: Specifies the type of the data encoded contained within the "data" field of a "RuntimeData" or "InitTimeData" object

values.description: The contents of the field should be treated as binary and not interpreted by MAA.
The contents of the field should be treated as a JSON object and may be further interpreted by MAA.

RuntimeData.description: Defines the "run time data" provided by the attestation target for use by the MAA

data.description: UTF-8 encoded Runtime Data generated by the trusted environment

dataType.description: The type of data contained within the "data" field

InitTimeData.description: Defines the "initialization time data" used to provision the attestation target for use by the MAA

data.description: UTF-8 encoded Initialization Data passed into the trusted environment when it is created.

dataType.description: The type of data contained within the "data" field

AttestSgxEnclaveRequest.description: Attestation request for Intel SGX enclaves

quote.description: Quote of the enclave to be attested

runtimeData.description: Runtime data provided by the enclave at the time of quote generation. The MAA will verify that the first 32 bytes of the report_data field of the quote contains the SHA256 hash of the decoded "data" field of the runtime data.

initTimeData.description: Initialization data provided when the enclave is created. MAA will verify that the init data was known to the enclave. Note that InitTimeData is invalid for CoffeeLake processors.

draftPolicyForAttestation.description: Attest against the provided draft policy. Note that the resulting token cannot be validated.

AttestOpenEnclaveRequest.description: Attestation request for Intel SGX enclaves

report.description: OpenEnclave report from the enclave to be attested

runtimeData.description: Runtime data provided by the enclave at the time of report generation. The MAA will verify that the first 32 bytes of the report_data field of the quote contains the SHA256 hash of the decoded "data" field of the runtime data.

initTimeData.description: Base64Url encoded "InitTime data". The MAA will verify that the init data was known to the enclave. Note that InitTimeData is invalid for CoffeeLake processors.

draftPolicyForAttestation.description: Attest against the provided draft policy. Note that the resulting token cannot be validated.

TpmAttestationRequest.description: Attestation request for Trusted Platform Module (TPM) attestation.

data.description: Protocol data containing artifacts for attestation.

TpmAttestationResponse.description: Attestation response for Trusted Platform Module (TPM) attestation.

data.description: Protocol data containing attestation service response.

AttestSevSnpVmRequest.description: Attestation request for AMD SEV SNP Virtual Machine

values.description: SEV SNP report generated by HCL running on HyperV platform

report.description: Hardware rooted report of the virtual machine being attested

runtimeData.description: Runtime data provided by the enclave at the time of report generation. The MAA will verify that the run time data is known to the attestation target.

initTimeData.description: Initialization data provided by the enclave at the time of report generation. The MAA will verify that the init time data is known to the attestation target.

draftPolicyForAttestation.description: Attest against the provided draft policy. Note that the resulting token cannot be validated.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: Client API version. Current version is 2010-10-01

AttestationType.description: Specifies the trusted execution environment to be used to validate the evidence
AttestationType.name: attestationType
